errors.error_description: The main banner image is linked to a specific, outdated release candidate version ('v0.10.0-rc.2') instead of the main branch, which may result in displaying an old or broken image.
correction_candidates: Update the image URL to point to the `main` branch: `.. image:: https://github.com/MiraGeoscience/geoapps/raw/main/docs/images/index_page.png`
Update the image URL to point to the `develop` branch: `.. image:: https://github.com/MiraGeoscience/geoapps/raw/develop/docs/images/index_page.png`
Remove the image directive entirely.
Update the image URL to point to the `latest` tag: `.. image:: https://github.com/MiraGeoscience/geoapps/raw/latest/docs/images/index_page.png`
errors.golden_answer: Update the image URL to point to the `main` branch: `.. image:: https://github.com/MiraGeoscience/geoapps/raw/main/docs/images/index_page.png`

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states 'this project requires Python 3.7 to run', which may conflict with the Python versions badge and cause confusion about actual compatibility.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence 'Please note that this project requires Python 3.7 to run.'
Change the sentence to 'Please note that this project requires Python >= 3.8 to run.' to match the likely supported versions.
Remove the `pyversions` badge to avoid contradiction.
Change the sentence to 'Check the `pyversions` badge for compatibility details.'
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'Please note that this project requires Python 3.7 to run.'

errors.error_description: The 'Download the latest' link incorrectly points to a zip archive of the `master` branch, but the repository's default branch is `main`, causing the link to be broken.
correction_candidates: Change the branch name in the URL from `master` to `main`: `.../archive/main.zip`
Change the branch name in the URL from `master` to `develop`: `.../archive/develop.zip`
Remove the 'Download the latest' link entirely.
Change the link to point to the GitHub releases page instead of a direct download.
errors.golden_answer: Change the branch name in the URL from `master` to `main`: `.../archive/main.zip`

errors.error_description: The link to the third-party software notices points to a non-existent file `THIRD_PARTY.rst`. The correct filename is `THIRD_PARTY_SOFTWARE.rst`.
correction_candidates: Correct the link target and definition to point to `THIRD_PARTY_SOFTWARE.rst`.
Change the link to an absolute URL pointing to the file on GitHub.
Remove the 'Third Party Software' section.
Correct the link target and definition to point to `LICENSE.rst`.
errors.golden_answer: Correct the link target and definition to point to `THIRD_PARTY_SOFTWARE.rst`.

errors.error_description: The documentation badge link points to the 'stable' version of the docs (`/en/stable/`), which may not exist or may be outdated. It should point to the 'latest' version.
correction_candidates:
Update the target URL to point to the 'latest' version of the docs: `.. |docs| image:: ...
    :target: https://geoapps.readthedocs.io/en/latest/`

Remove the version from the URL path: `.. |docs| image:: ...
    :target: https://geoapps.readthedocs.io/`

Update the target URL to point to the main documentation index: `.. |docs| image:: ...
    :target: https://geoapps.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html`
Remove the `|docs|` badge and its definition.
errors.golden_answer:
Update the target URL to point to the 'latest' version of the docs: `.. |docs| image:: ...
    :target: https://geoapps.readthedocs.io/en/latest/`

errors.error_description: The 'Quick Start' section provides an incorrect command `geoapps --run` to start the application, which is not a valid command or parameter.
correction_candidates: Remove the 'Quick Start' section as it provides a wrong command.
Correct the command to a plausible entry point, e.g., `python -m geoapps.cli`.
Replace the command with instructions to see the documentation: 'Please see the documentation for usage instructions.'
Correct the command to `geoapps --help` to show available options.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the 'Quick Start' section as it provides a wrong command.
